data.enText: Please don't stand on ceremony (= Please be natural and relaxed) with me.
in a very rough or informal way
data.chText: 粗鲁无礼；不拘礼节；随便

data.enText: He found himself pushed without ceremony out of the house and the door slammed in his face.
data.chText: 他被毫不客气地推出了屋子，门砰的一声当着他的面关上了。

tr: any activity that is performed in an especially solemn elaborate or formal way
example: the ceremony of smelling the cork and tasting the wine
he makes a ceremony of addressing his golf ball
he disposed of it without ceremony

tr: the proper or conventional behavior on some solemn occasion
a formal event performed on a special occasion

partsOfSpeech.dec: harm- 适合 + -mony 名词后缀

data.enText: a public or religious occasion that includes a series of formal or traditional actions
formal behaviour; traditional actions and words used on particular formal occasions
Please don't stand on ceremony (= Please be natural and relaxed) with me.
in a very rough or informal way
data.chText: 粗鲁无礼；不拘礼节；随便

data.enText: He found himself pushed without ceremony out of the house and the door slammed in his face.
data.chText: 他被毫不客气地推出了屋子，门砰的一声当着他的面关上了。

simple_means.memory_skill: cere n.蜡膜 + -mony 名词后缀

ex.enText: This is an entirely new sort of wedding ceremony.
ex.chText: 这是一场别开生面的婚礼。

synonyms.bx: 指用于婚礼、葬礼等严格履行一定程序的重要典礼。

ex.enText: This festival originates from a religious rite.
ex.chText: 这一节日起源于宗教仪式。

ex.enText: Such traditional rites are performed only by the women of the village.
ex.chText: 举行这类传统仪式的只有村里的女人。

synonyms.bx: 指总以同一种方式举行的宗教仪式。

ex.enText: Many American families make a ritual of praying before meals.
ex.chText: 许多美国家庭在饭前祈祷。

ex.enText: A ridiculous diplomatic ritual will play out once again.
ex.chText: 一场荒唐的外交上的例行公事将再次进行。

synonyms.bx: 指宗教仪式，也可指反复进行的习惯性活动。

ex.enText: The service was held in the church.
The thanksgiving service will be held in the chapel.
ex.chText: 感恩节礼拜仪式将在小教堂举行。

synonyms.bx: 尤指在教堂举行的正式的宗教仪式。

example.ex: ...his grandmother's funeral, a private ceremony attended only by the family...
example.tran: 他祖母的葬礼，只有家人参加的私人仪式

example.ex: Today's award ceremony took place at the British Embassy in Tokyo.
example.tran: 今天的颁奖典礼在英国驻东京大使馆举行。

value.def: A ceremony is a formal event such as a wedding.

example.ex: The Republic was proclaimed in public with great ceremony.
example.tran: 共和国在公开场合非常隆重地宣布成立。

example.ex: ...the pomp and ceremony of the Pope's visit.
example.tran: 教皇来访的盛况和礼仪

value.def: Ceremony consists of the special things that are said and done on very formal occasions.

example.ex: 'Is Hilton here?' she asked without ceremony.

value.def: If you do something without ceremony, you do it quickly and in a casual way.

trans: 婚礼；结婚典礼；婚礼仪式；结婚仪式；典礼
签约仪式；川港合作协议签署仪式；签字仪式；签字典礼
颁奖仪式；颁奖晚会；颁奖典礼；颁奖盛典；颁奖大会
茶道(日本沏茶和饮茶的礼仪)
就职典礼，开幕典礼，落成典礼
